alert.note: Alert for Forest; Langlade; Lincoln; Marathon; Menominee; Northern Marinette County; Northern Oconto County; Oneida; Southern Marinette County (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 6:02PM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Forest, Lincoln, northern Marathon, northern Marinette, southeastern Oneida, northwestern Menominee, northern Oconto and Langlade Counties through 645 PM CDT... At 601 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Woodlawn to near Stanley. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Wausau, Antigo, Crandon, Merrill, Rib Mountain, Tomahawk, Abbotsford, Harrison, Spencer and Pembine. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
